gov.usgs.volcanoes.core

Class Zip

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.volcanoes.core.Zip

  • public class Zip
extends Object
    Utility classes for working with the JDK Inflator/ Deflator implementation.
    Author:
    Dan Cervelli

    • Method Detail

      • compress

        public static byte[] compress(byte[] bytes)
        Compresses an array of bytes using the JDK Inflator/ Deflator implementation set for maximum speed. Compression ratios comparable to gzip are attained.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the array of bytes
        Returns:
        the compressed array of bytes

      • compress

        public static byte[] compress(byte[] bytes,
              int level)
        Compresses an array of bytes using the JDK Inflator/ Deflator implementation. Compression ratios comparable to gzip are attained.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the array of bytes
        level - the compression level (1[least]-9[most])
        Returns:
        the compressed array of bytes

      • compress

        public static byte[] compress(byte[] bytes,
              int level,
              int ofs,
              int len)
        Compresses an array of bytes using the JDK Inflator/ Deflator implementation. Compression ratios comparable to gzip are attained.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the array of bytes
        level - the compression level (1[least]-9[most])
        ofs - number of first byte in array to process
        len - length of processed array zone
        Returns:
        the compressed array of bytes

      • decompress

        public static byte[] decompress(byte[] bytes)
        Decompresses an array of bytes compressed via the Util.compress() methods. Uses a bufferSize of 64K.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the compressed bytes
        Returns:
        the decompressed array of bytes

      • decompress

        public static byte[] decompress(byte[] bytes,
                int bufferSize)
        Decompresses an array of bytes compressed via the Util.compress() methods. Use a bufferSize slightly larger than the expected size of the decompressed data for maximum efficiency.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the compressed bytes
        bufferSize - the decompression buffer size
        Returns:
        the decompressed array of bytes
